Detailed Description

The class CallHandler supports basic call handling functions. This basic functionality comprises features which neither are specific for mobile terminated nor originated calls, e.g., release of calls. Furthermore, there are methods for DMTF tone generation.

Method for manual clearing of the blacklist. Always successful.

CallDispatcher* CallHandler::GetCallDispatcher (   )  [inline]
 

Returns a pointer to the CallDispatcher object of the CallHandler. Required to have access to several methods of the CallDispatcher.

Returns:
A pointer to an object of class CallDispatcher

BOOLEAN CallHandler::GetDefaultClirMode (  ClirMode &  clir_mode  )  [static]
 

Get default CLIR mode from NVRAM.

Read default CLIR mode from NVRAM. The default CLIR mode is used for each call setup, if no dedicated CLIR mode is given at setup.

clir_mode The default CLIR mode

Returns:
TRUE, if reading from NVRAM was successful FALSE, if reading from in NVRAM failed

BOOLEAN CallHandler::GetDefaultCugInfo (  CugDescriptor &  cug_desc  )  [static]
 

Get default CUG info from NVRAM.

Read default CUG info from NVRAM. The default CUG info is used for each call setup, if no dedicated CUG info is given at setup.

cug_desc The default CUG info.

Returns:
TRUE, if storing in NVRAM was successful FALSE, if storing in NVRAM failed

DtmfDispatcher* CallHandler::GetDtmfDispatcher (   )  [inline]
 

Returns a pointer to the DtmfDispatcher object of the CallHandler. Required in order to be able to remove the dispatcher in case of disconnection of the respective call.

Returns:
A pointer to an object of class DtmfDispatcher

HandlerId CallHandler::GetHandlerId (   )  const [virtual]
 

CallApiRc CallHandler::RejectAllMoc (  BOOLEAN  activate  )  [static]
 

Enables/disables blocking of all mobile originated calls. If enabled the MN will reject all mobile terminated call setups with cause 'call rejected'.

Parameters:
activate TRUE activates, FALSE deactivates blocking.
Returns:
See CallHdl::RejectAllMtc(...).

CallApiRc CallHandler::RejectAllMtc (  BOOLEAN  activate  )  [static]
 

Enables/disables blocking of all mobile terminated calls. If enabled the MN will reject all mobile terminated call setups with cause 'call rejected'.

Parameters:
activate TRUE activates, FALSE deactivates blocking.
Returns:
See CallHdl::RejectAllMtc(...).

CallApiRc CallHandler::Release (  CallIndex  call_index,
UINT32 &  call_duration,
CallErrorCause  cause,
BOOLEAN  wait_condition = FALSE
) 
 

Sends a release request for the call corresponding to call_index to the protocol stack. The call will be removed from the internal data structure immediately. The disconnect confirmation will be sent by the network or, if a 30sec timer expires, by the stack itself.

Parameters:
call_index The reference to the call to be released.
call_duration See CallHdl::Release(...).
Returns:
See CallHdl::Release(...).

void CallHandler::RequestRedialStatus (   )  [static]
 

Requests the current redial-status, which will be provided by RedialStatusMsg

BOOLEAN CallHandler::SetDefaultClirMode (  ClirMode  clir_mode  )  [static]
 

Set default CLIR mode in NVRAM.

Store default CLIR mode to NVRAM. The default CLIR mode is used for each call setup, if no dedicated CLIR mode is given at setup.

clir_mode The default CLIR mode

Returns:
TRUE, if storing in NVRAM was successful FALSE, if storing in NVRAM failed

BOOLEAN CallHandler::SetDefaultCugInfo (  const CugDescriptor &  cug_desc  )  [static]
 

Set default CUG info in NVRAM.

Store default CUG info to NVRAM. The default CUG info is used for each call setup, if no dedicated CUG info is given at setup.

cug_desc The default CUG info.

Returns:
TRUE, if storing in NVRAM was successful FALSE, if storing in NVRAM failed

void CallHandler::SetMnRediallingEnabled (  BOOLEAN  action  )  [static]
 

Enables the Mobile Network redialling mechanism but does not activated it. By default, the MN-internal redialling mechanism is enabled.

Parameters:
action TRUE sets the mechnalism enabled, FALSE sets the mechanism disabled.

CallApiRc CallHandler::StartDtmfToneGeneration (  CallIndex  idx,
KeyCode  key
) 
 

Starts the generation of a DTMF tone during an active voice call.

Parameters:
key A KeyCode 0, 1, ... 9, * or #.
call_index The reference to the active voice call.
Returns:
See CallHdl::StartDtmfToneGeneration(...).

CallApiRc CallHandler::StopDtmfToneGeneration (  CallIndex  idx  ) 
 

Stops the previosly started generation of a DTMF tone.

Parameters:
call_index The reference to the active voice call.
Returns:
See CallHdl::StartDtmfToneGeneration(...).
